entry.title: Inbound delivery attachment
entry.content:
Hi Team,

User is attaching the PDF documents as attachment in change inbound delivery app as we are using WM. Another user wants to see that attachment in VL33N as that user have only display access. When user click on service object --> attachment list in VL33N, it is grayed out and user can't see the attachment.

Can you share the details how to achieve this requirement.

Thanks

Pavan

entry.title: EDI 862 - No Sales Scheduling agreements found
entry.content:
I'm just trying to build a EDI 862 interface in my project. supporting in SD functional doamin on this.
While triggering the EDI 862 in S4HANA public cloud, it is giving the error "No sales scheduling agreements found".
We have done the configs like assign sold to parties and manage delivery schedule processing and all others correctly and provied the right data in the payload. but still getting the same error.
I'll attach the error message snapshot here.

Can anyone please help on this?
This is a priority work for me.

  • New material extension / verification

  • Period-end reporting

entry.title: Output Parameters for Handling Unit Label Printing in Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I am trying to print a handling unit (HU) label in SAP Public Cloud via an outbound delivery using the EXTOM channel. However, when processing it in BarTender, I am missing the printer and the label type that should be printed.

I have already used a BAdI to extend the output parameters and successfully added some missing information. However, I would like to have additional details available in the output parameter determination, such as warehouse number, HU type, step, etc., because with these data I could determine which form to send and specify a printer.

Is there a way to include these fields in the generated output file? Any guidance or examples would be greatly appreciated.

Etiqueta de UMp (HU_LABEL) | SAP Help Portal

entry.title: How, in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, to store and map the vendor/sender GLN
entry.content:
Hello support

We need to understand how to include the vendor (sending party) data in the outbound sales APIs, such as CO_EDI_INVOICE_REQUEST_OUT and CO_EDI_DELIVERY_REQUEST_OUT, in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.

  • In the classic DELVRY IDoc, this information was included in segment E1EDRM1 with qualifier OSO.
  • In the classic INVOIC IDoc, it was included in segment E1EDKA1 with qualifier LFL.
  • The GLN (Global Location Number) for the vendor/sender was maintained in table V_EAN_GLN, and the system would collect it from there to populate the respective segment in the IDoc.

We would like to know the recommended way to provide and extract this vendor/sender GLN information for the equivalent Party node in the outbound API payload. Which table or configuration is now used in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, and how can we map this data so that it is displayed correctly in the output, analogous to how it worked previously with IDoc segments and V_EAN_GLN?

Thank you in advance for your guidance.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Tax code via price determination cannot be determined – Intercompany Settlement (CCS)
entry.content:
I am working on a configuration scenario in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and I am facing an issue with tax code determination during pricing. When creating the document, the system stops with the following error:

“Tax code via price determination cannot be determined, check Customizing.”

 

These are the configurations in the system (Intercompany between Germany and the US):

 

Procedure Royalties IC In (Germany)

Procedure Royalties IC Out (Germany)

Procedure Royalties IC In (US)

The Condition Type RITT has a reference cond. type TTX1

Set Tax Rates - Purchasing

Material Tax Data

Business Partner Output Tax details:

Any insights into why the tax code is not being determined in Public Cloud, or which specific configuration might be missing, would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: OUTSTANDING CAPITAL BALANCE TO BE AMORTIZED (FIXED ASSETS) WITHOUT ASSIGNMENT.
entry.content:
Good morning,

I am currently performing the accounting data uploads for our client and I'm encountering a problem when loading the Fixed Assets.

Once the master data and fixed asset postings have been uploaded, when I check the Balance Sheet, I see that the fixed assets, including both their acquisition and their depreciation, are correct. The problem is that the difference between the acquisition value and the amortized capital (net book value) is being taken below to "WITHOUT ASSIGNMENT" using a specific SAP account that is configured in the Account Determination, and it shows a negative value.

We need to know if this is correct, if we have the wrong account in the Account Determination, or if we would have to make a clearing entry after the upload to move that value to a specific part of the Balance Sheet.

I am attaching screenshots of how the balance sheet appears and the configuration of the Account Determination.

Thank you very much. Regards.

entry.title: Bulgaria EUR Transition_Material inventory balance Migration from old company code BG10 to new BG20
entry.content:
Hi All,

We are currently preparing for the Bulgaria EUR Transition and starting Mock 1 activities in our SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Test System. As part of this exercise, we need to migrate the Material Inventory Balance from the source company code BG10 to the target company code BG20.

We request SAP’s official and detailed documentation/steps for performing the Material Inventory Balance migration using the SAP Data Migration Cockpit (Migrate Data Using Staging Tables).

Specifically, we need clarification on the following:

  1. Step-by-step procedure to migrate Material Inventory Balance using the “Material Inventory Balance” migration object in Public Cloud.

  2. Whether SAP provides any standard extract for inventory value (quantity + valuation amount) for Public Cloud.

  3. Instructions for correctly populating the following staging templates delivered by SAP:

    • S_MARA#FreeText_Mandatory.csv

    • S_MARD#FreeText_Mandatory.csv
      Do these files need to be uploaded in sequence?

  4. Any SAP-provided Bulgaria EUR Transition–specific migration guidelines for material stock.

    Given the criticality of the EUR transition timeline, we request urgent guidance and the official SAP steps or documentation to ensure we follow the correct procedure.

    Thank you for your support.
    Adyasha Patra

Is it purely licensing or is it a completely different technical framework?

 

Kind regards,

R

entry.title: Issue Accessing Withholding Tax Configuration Apps in S/4HANA Cloud – Missing Business Catalogs
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We are currently validating the configuration of withholding tax in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, and during the tax calculation review we identified that the system is returning incorrect values compared to the expected configuration.

When verifying the setup, we found that two key configuration points are inaccessible due to missing system authorizations. According to the official SAP documentation, these configuration steps require access through specific Business Catalogs; however, when searching for them within our system, no results are returned, preventing us from completing the validation.

The applications we need access to are:

  • Define Withholding Tax Keys Specific to the Country/Region (ID: 106626)

  • Assign Withholding Tax Keys to Withholding Tax Codes (ID: 105911)

Additionally, we referenced SAP documentation where these Business Catalogs appear as configuration elements for countries such as Spain and Indonesia, but they do not seem to be available in our tenant.

Given this situation, we are considering raising a support case under the B-Component XX-CBC-CE-CON (CBC – Configuration Environment). Before doing so, I would like to confirm with the community:

Questions

  1. Are these configuration applications deprecated, country-specific, or currently restricted in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (2508)?

  2. Is there an updated Business Catalog or role required to enable access to these specific withholding tax configuration steps?

  3. Has anyone experienced the same issue where the Business Catalogs referenced in SAP documentation are not available in the system?

  4. Should this indeed be escalated through a CBC support case, or is there an alternative resolution (e.g., different catalog, role collection, or change in country template availability)?

I have attached evidence showing that the Business Catalogs related to these apps appear in SAP documentation but are not available in our system.

Thank you in advance for your guidance and any insights you can share.

entry.title: How To Set The PO Price Type Default Value
entry.content:
PO Price Type – Need Default as “NET PRICE”
In the PR, the field “PO Price Type” provides a dropdown (Net Price, Do Not Adopt, etc.).

Business Requirement:
The system should default the PO Price Type to “Net price.”

Expected Behavior:
The PO Price Type should default to “Net Price” during PR creation.
Actual Behavior:
The PO Price Type is not defaulting to the required value.
Steps to Reproduce:
Go to Create Purchase Requisition.
Check PO Price Type field → default value is incorrect.
Request:
Kindly investigate the configuration behind these two behaviors and provide the required corrections so that:
The PO Price Type defaults automatically to “Net Price.”


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Public Cloud - Debit/Credit Shift Between FSV Nodes - API or CDS view
entry.content:
Dear all,

We are currently working on a project in which the business intelligence functionality is handled in an external system. As part of this setup, we transfer financial data — such as assets and liabilities — to that system, and the Debit/Credit Shift Between FSV Nodes is activated.

However, for the accounts where this function is enabled, we do not receive any information indicating whether the journal entry was posted to an asset or liability account. We have not been able to retrieve this information through any available API or CDS view, nor have we found a way to automatically identify which accounts are flagged for the shift within the hierarchy.

We kindly request your support in identifying how this information can be retrieved.

Kind regards,
William
